intro: Dyschoriste capricornis, commonly known as the Capricorn dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dyschoriste capricornis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
